Scheduled Flights to be operated pursuant to this Agreement and to be provided by and
over the routes of Northwest (collectively, &#147;Ticketing Services&#148;). Nothing in this
<U>Section&nbsp;4.07(a)</U> shall be deemed to alter or conflict with the provisions of
<U>Section&nbsp;9.01</U> hereof. Air carriers and other agencies other than Northwest may
also issue tickets for travel to be performed by Pinnacle.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) <U>Booking and Ticketing Procedures</U>. The procedures followed and
standards applied by Pinnacle in booking flights and performing the Ticketing Services
shall conform in all material respects to Northwest&#146;s own tariffs, procedures and
standards applicable to the booking of Northwest flights and the issuance of Northwest
Tickets and to the collection and remittance of the proceeds of such sales. Pinnacle
employees booking flights and performing Ticketing Services shall adhere to Northwest&#146;s
procedures and standards as shall be provided to Pinnacle in writing. In accordance
with <U>Section&nbsp;8.02</U> below, Pinnacle shall be responsible for collecting and shall
pay to Northwest any Ticket Taxes and Fees required to be collected under applicable law
on Tickets sold by Pinnacle utilizing Northwest ticket stock.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) <U>Frequent Flyer Program</U>. Pinnacle agrees to accept Northwest frequent
flyer tickets and to provide transportation services pursuant to such tickets at no
charge to Northwest. All travel under the frequent flyer program solely on
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->27<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle shall entitle a passenger to such credit as shall be equivalent to the
credit offered on Northwest for comparable mileage segments. Northwest will provide
such credit to members of its frequent flyer program who travel on Pinnacle at no charge
to Pinnacle.</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) <U>Supplies</U>. Northwest shall, at its sole expense, provide an adequate
supply of ticket office forms and specialized supplies (such as baggage tags, but
excluding normal office supplies such as paper, stationery, envelopes, memo pads and the
like) bearing the NW Identification for use by Pinnacle subject to the applicable
provisions of Article&nbsp;VII below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e) <U>Ticketing Costs</U>. All travel agency commissions attributable to
Scheduled Flights shall be Northwest&#146;s expense. Northwest shall pay all computer
reservation system fees attributable to passengers on Scheduled Flights. In the event
Governmental Regulations preclude the payment of these fees by Northwest and Pinnacle
then pays them, Northwest shall immediately begin paying Pinnacle a &#147;Traffic Referral&#148;
commission on a semi-monthly basis in an amount equal to such fees formerly paid by
Northwest for Pinnacle. Such commission shall be retroactive to the date on which such
fees were no longer lawfully paid by Northwest and shall be included in the semi-monthly
payments to be made by Northwest pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.02</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;4.08 </B><U><B>Baggage Handling Services</B></U>. &#147;Baggage Handling Services&#148; shall consist
of the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;At all Northwest Service Cities and Hub Cities, Pinnacle and Northwest shall exchange and
transfer baggage in accordance with procedures to be mutually agreed upon and generally utilized by
the parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The procedures utilized in performing such Baggage Handling Services shall conform in all
respects to Northwest&#146;s own standards and procedures as adapted to Pinnacle&#146;s Aircraft and
operations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;For purposes of baggage claims, Pinnacle will be treated as if it were a party to standard
industry ticketing and baggage agreements with Northwest and other air carriers. Pinnacle will
make available at the request of any passenger excess valuation insurance, if any, offered by
Northwest to the extent such insurance covers Pinnacle&#146;s flights and Northwest&#146;s flights.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;4.09 </B><U><B>Air Cargo Handling Services</B></U>. &#147;Air Cargo Handling Services&#148; shall
consist of the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;At each location at which Northwest operates Ticketing Services, Northwest shall at no
charge to Pinnacle accept Air Cargo for shipment on flights to be operated by and over the routes
of Pinnacle or Northwest. Northwest shall issue air waybills covering Air Cargo and shall prepare a
&#147;Transfer Manifest&#148; for each Pinnacle flight on which there shall be an Air Cargo shipment which
transfer manifest shall set forth all Air Cargo to be carried on the flight.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->28<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Northwest hereby appoints Pinnacle as its agent, and Pinnacle hereby agrees to act as
Northwest&#146;s agent, at all Pinnacle ticketing locations in connection with the sale and issuance of
all air waybills by Pinnacle and with the same duties owed to Northwest in that capacity as is
customary in the industry between airlines. Pinnacle agrees to observe all Northwest procedures
and standards applicable to the issuance of air waybills and to the collection and remittance of
the proceeds of such sales. Pinnacle employees performing such duties shall adhere to Northwest&#146;s
procedures and standards as shall be provided to Pinnacle in writing. In accordance with
<U>Section&nbsp;8.02</U> below, Pinnacle shall be responsible for collecting and shall pay to Northwest
any Ticket Taxes and Fees required to be collected under applicable law on air waybills sold by
Pinnacle utilizing Northwest air waybills. Nothing in this <U>Section&nbsp;4.09(b)</U> shall be deemed
to alter or conflict with the provisions of <U>Section&nbsp;9.01</U> hereof. Air carriers other than
Northwest may also issue air waybills for cargo transportation to be performed by Pinnacle.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Pinnacle shall provide Air Cargo handling services at Pinnacle&#146;s ticketing locations for
and on behalf of Northwest for Air Cargo carried solely on Pinnacle or on both a Pinnacle flight
and a Northwest flight. Such handling services shall be performed in accordance with Northwest&#146;s
procedures and standards as provided to Pinnacle in writing, including but not limited to (1)
accepting all Air Cargo that Northwest accepts, such as pets/AVI (other live animals), human
remains, Priority Service (SPC)&nbsp;freight and perishables, unless otherwise mutually agreed, and (2)
keeping facilities open at least one and one-half (1.5) hours before and one (1)&nbsp;hour after each
Scheduled Flight for customers to deliver and pick up Air Cargo.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;For Air Cargo carried solely on Pinnacle or on both an Pinnacle flight and a Northwest
flight, Pinnacle and Northwest shall charge rates in accordance with Northwest&#146;s applicable rates
and tariffs; such revenues shall be paid 100% to and retained by Northwest.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;For purposes of Air Cargo claims, Pinnacle will be treated as if it were a party to
standard industry ticketing and baggage agreements with Northwest and other air carriers.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;Northwest shall, at its sole expense, supply Pinnacle with all necessary Air Cargo forms
and supplies in an agreed upon form with the NW Identification, subject to the applicable
provisions of Article&nbsp;VII below. Northwest and Pinnacle shall utilize such forms and supplies when
accepting Air Cargo for transport on Pinnacle&#146;s flights.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;4.10 </B><U><B>Use of COMAT</B></U>. Northwest and Pinnacle shall each provide to the
other, at no cost to the other and on a non-discriminatory basis, access to its respective COMAT
system for the movement and acquisition of priority aircraft maintenance parts and other company
material. Northwest&#146;s failure to deliver timely a maintenance component via COMAT, whether timely
or at all, shall not cause an affected Scheduled Flight to be excluded in calculating Pinnacle&#146;s
on-time performance and completion factors. All access shall be consistent with Northwest&#146;s and
Pinnacle&#146;s respective published COMAT procedures and policies, as amended from time to time.
Northwest shall provide to Pinnacle at no cost and on a non-discriminatory basis, access to
Northwest&#146;s VIP express cargo service to the extent necessary for Aircraft out of service recovery.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->29<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;4.11 </B><U><B>Slots and Route Authorities</B></U>. During the term of this Agreement
(including any Renewal Terms) or upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, Northwest
may, in its sole discretion, require Pinnacle to transfer to Northwest or its designee at no charge
any airport takeoff or landing slots, route authorities or other regulatory authorities as
Northwest shall designate which have been or are being used for Regional Airlines Services under
this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;4.12 </B><U><B>Emergency Response and Family Assistance</B></U>. Northwest and Pinnacle
shall enter into a separate written agreement with respect to emergency response and family
assistance services to be provided to Pinnacle by Northwest at no charge in connection with the
Regional Airlines Services operated under this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>ARTICLE V</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>REVENUES, PAYMENTS AND SETOFF</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.01 </B><U><B>Revenues</B></U>. Pinnacle acknowledges and agrees that all revenues
resulting from the sale and issuance of passenger tickets and cargo air waybills associated with
the operation of the Aircraft and all other sources of revenue associated with the operation of the
Aircraft are the sole property of Northwest, including without limitation ticket change fees and
other fees or charges which are applicable pursuant to Northwest&#146;s tariffs, unaccompanied minor
fees, beverage services, excess baggage fees and nonrevenue pass travel charges.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.02 </B><U><B>Payments to Pinnacle</B></U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Reports</U>. Pinnacle shall provide to Northwest periodic reports with respect to the
number of actual, completed Block Hours, and Cycles by category as defined in <U>Section
5.03(b)</U> of regional jet service flown by Pinnacle (each in respect of Scheduled Flights,
Charter Flights and Non-Scheduled Flights) in accordance with the following schedule in each
calendar month during the term of this Agreement:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="75%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="30%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Day of Month Report Due</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Period Covered by Report</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">22
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">1<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">st</SUP> &#151; 15th of Month</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">7
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Complete Previous Month</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle shall also provide Northwest periodic reports with respect to its Available CRJ Days, CRJ
deliveries, and its expenses with respect to Section&nbsp;5.05 and Section&nbsp;5.06 in accordance with the
following schedule in each calendar month during the term of this Agreement:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="75%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="30%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Day of Month Report Due</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Period Covered by Report</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">7
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Complete Previous Month</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Payment Schedule</U>. Northwest shall remit to Pinnacle by wire transfer of
immediately available funds by the close of business on the 30th day of each calendar month (or
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->30<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">the next banking day if the 30th is a bank holiday), as a provisional payment, Pinnacle&#146;s
Block Hour Payment, Cycle Payment, IOP Payment and any payments due pursuant to <U>Section
5.05</U> below for the period covered by the Block Hour Report and Cycle Report furnished by
Pinnacle on the 22nd day of the month and the payment due in respect of Equipment Rental Expense
pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.06 below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest shall remit to Pinnacle by wire transfer of immediately available funds by the close of
business on the 15th day of each month (or the next banking day if the 15th is a bank holiday), as
a final payment, Pinnacle&#146;s Block Hour Payment, Cycle Payment, IOP Payment, Fixed Cost Payment,
Monthly Margin Payment, any payments due pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.05</U> or <U>Section&nbsp;5.06</U>
below for the preceding month and any payments due with respect to Charter Flights, less the amount
of the provisional payment made on the 30th day of the preceding month.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this <U>Section&nbsp;5.02</U>, the above-referenced payments to Pinnacle shall be
calculated as follows for any applicable period:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) the Block Hour Payment will be equal to the then applicable Block Hour Rate
multiplied by the number of actual, completed Block Hours reported in Pinnacle&#146;s Block Hour
Report for such period for Scheduled Flights, Non-Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights,
plus
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) the Cycle Payment will be equal to the then applicable Cycle Rates multiplied by
the number of actual, completed Cycles for each respective category in Section&nbsp;5.03(b)
reported in Pinnacle&#146;s Cycle Report for such period for Scheduled Flights and Non-Scheduled
Flights, plus
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) the IOP Payment, if any, will be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.03(c)
below, plus
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) any payments due pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.05 below, plus
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) with respect to the payment to be made on the 15th day of each month, Pinnacle&#146;s
Fixed Cost Payment determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.04 below and any payments due
pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.06 below, plus
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi) with respect to the payment to be made on the 15th day of each month, the Monthly
Margin Payment determined in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.08</U> or <U>Section&nbsp;5.11</U>
below, as applicable.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Adjustments arising from Northwest&#146;s audit of the Block Hour Report, Cycle Report, Available CRJ
Days Report, CRJ Deliveries Report, Section&nbsp;5.05 Report, or Section&nbsp;5.06 Report may be made within
ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the end of each month. Any reference to the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> day of a
month in this Section&nbsp;5 will be deemed to mean the last day of February with respect to that month.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.03 </B><U><B>Block Hour and Cycle Rates; IOP Program Adjustment</B></U>
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">NW Cities means Northwest Service Cities.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">CS Cities means Contracted Service Cities.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PS Cities means Pinnacle Service Cities</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U>IOP Program Incident Adjustment</U>. If during any month during the term of this
Agreement Pinnacle cancels one or more Scheduled Flights in connection with one or more IOP Program
Incidents, Northwest shall pay to Pinnacle an amount determined in accordance with the following
formula:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;P=((IBH)*(BHR)*(&#091;***&#093;)) &#043; ((ICYC)*(CYCR)*(&#091;***&#093;))
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;P is the IOP Payment to be made to Pinnacle,
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->32<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">IBH is the number of scheduled Block Hours cancelled in connection with the IOP
Program Incident(s), calculated by the following formula:</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">IBH=Pinnacle scheduled Block Hours in Hub cancelled * (((% points of
Pinnacle&#146;s Scheduled Flights in Hub cancelled)-(% points of Northwest
scheduled flights in Hub cancelled))/(% points of Pinnacle&#146;s Scheduled
Flights in Hub cancelled)),</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">BHR is the then applicable Block Hour Rate in which such IOP Program Incident(s)
occurred,<BR>
ICYC is the number of scheduled Cycles cancelled in connection with the IOP Program
Incident(s), calculated by the following formula:</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">ICYC=Pinnacle&#146;s scheduled Cycles in Hub cancelled * (((% points of
Pinnacle&#146;s Scheduled Flights in Hub cancelled)-(% points of Northwest
scheduled flights in Hub cancelled))/(% points of Pinnacle&#146;s Scheduled
Flights in Hub cancelled))), and</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">CYCR is the then applicable Cycle Rate by category as defined in <U>Section
5.03(b)</U> in which such IOP Program Incident(s) occurred.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.04 </B><U><B>Fixed Costs</B></U>. Pinnacle&#146;s Fixed Cost Payment arising from operation of
the Aircraft shall be calculated on a monthly basis as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed Cost Payment = &#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.05 </B><U><B>Fuel</B></U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Fuel Administration</U>. Subject to Pinnacle&#146;s consent (which shall not be
unreasonably withheld), Pinnacle will join the fuel consortium at a Service City upon Northwest&#146;s
request. Northwest will provide to Pinnacle the following fuel-related administrative services:
(i)&nbsp;negotiation of fuel supply, fuel storage and into-plane service contracts for the Aircraft,
(ii)&nbsp;payment of all into-plane and fuel invoices in respect of the Aircraft, (iii)&nbsp;monthly
reconciliations (by the 15th of the following month) with respect to fuel boarded, inventory and
purchases, and (iv)&nbsp;monthly reports with respect to fuel boarded by station, flight and Aircraft.
For the avoidance of doubt, Northwest will not charge Pinnacle for fuel supply, fuel storage or
into-plane services with respect to the Aircraft.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Fuel Payment</U>. Pinnacle shall have the right to audit on a semi-annual basis the
determination of the number of gallons of aircraft fuel boarded and payment of all into-
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->33<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">plane and fuel invoices in respect of the Aircraft and shall report any disputes to Northwest.
Any dispute not reported to Northwest within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the conclusion of such audit
shall be deemed waived.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Northwest&#146;s fuel department shall have the right to audit on a monthly basis the determination
of the number of gallons of aircraft fuel boarded and fuel price paid and shall report any disputes
to Pinnacle. Any dispute not reported to Pinnacle within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the conclusion of
such audit shall be deemed waived.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U>Pinnacle Reporting Procedures</U>. Pinnacle will provide to Northwest the following
fuel administrative service assistance: (i)&nbsp;timely Fuel Management System (&#147;FMS&#148;) data entry by
Pinnacle at Pinnacle Service Cities including month-end reconciling to the fixed base operator
(&#147;FBO&#148;) by the end of the second business day, (ii)&nbsp;FMS coverage by Pinnacle when regular FMS
person is on vacation, leave, etc., (iii)&nbsp;Pinnacle will train new Pinnacle employees on FMS due to
turnover, vacation, etc., (iv)&nbsp;problems at FBO regarding supply of fuel slips and bill of lading
receipts will be addressed by Pinnacle personnel first before involving the Northwest Fuel
Department.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;<U>Fuel Burn Review Procedures &#151; CRJ</U>. Northwest and Pinnacle agree to review the
fuel burn performance (defined as gallons per block hour) of the Aircraft for compliance with
annual performance measures including, but not limited to:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) Planned Fuel On Arrival (FOA)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) Planned Zero Fuel Weight (ZFW)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) Auxiliary Power Unit (APU)&nbsp;Usage
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) Cruise Speed
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) Cruise Altitude
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pinnacle will be responsible for the development and setting of the annual performance measure
targets for the Aircraft, each as defined in Exhibit&nbsp;F, and an annual budgeted fuel burn rate
expressed in gallons per block hour (&#147;All-in Rate&#148;), in a timeframe consistent with the development
of the annual operating expense budget of each party. The All-in Rate shall encompass all
scheduled and non-scheduled burned gallons and include the measures defined in (d)(i-v) above and
those measures the parties may agree to subsequently add. The annual targets for the performance
measures and All-in Rate will be subject to Northwest&#146;s review and approval. If the parties are
unable to reach agreement, the procedures set forth in Section&nbsp;5.10(f) will be utilized to
establish the annual targets and the All-in Rate. Additional performance measures may be
identified and added at a future date by mutual agreement of the parties for purposes of reviewing
the Aircraft&#146;s annual fuel burn. In the event data is not yet available for a given measure, no
annual target will be set. The parties agree to use reasonable best efforts in researching and
collecting data for purposes of adding performance measures and cooperation may not be unreasonably
withheld by either party.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->34<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Not later than sixty (60)&nbsp;days following the end of the year for which the targets applied,
Pinnacle shall (i)&nbsp;deliver to Northwest the analysis and conclusion of Pinnacle&#146;s performance for
the year then ended with respect to each of the performance measures and the All-in Rate, and (ii)
provide Northwest with the data used by Pinnacle to determine variances to each of the performance
measure targets and the All-in Rate in a format specified by Northwest. The analysis shall
include, but not be limited to, adjustment for changes in the operating schedule from the Annual
Operating Plan. For example, adjusting planned taxi time or average length of flight to actual
experience for the year completed. Northwest shall have thirty (30)&nbsp;days from the receipt of
Pinnacle&#146;s analysis to complete its review. If it is determined that Pinnacle exceeded one or more
of the targets for the annual performance measures, and the cause of exceeding the targets was
within the control of Pinnacle, a fuel penalty shall be assessed per the formulas set forth in
Exhibit&nbsp;F. If it is determined that Pinnacle exceeded the budget for the All-in Rate, after
adjusting for variances to target for the performance measures, and the cause of exceeding the
budget was within the control of Pinnacle, a fuel penalty shall be assessed per the formula set
forth in Exhibit&nbsp;F. Such penalty payment(s) shall be made in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.07.</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.06 </B><U><B>Direct Expenses</B></U>. Northwest will reimburse Pinnacle for the following
expenses at the Direct Cost to Pinnacle. Reimbursement for these expenses paid or accrued by
Pinnacle in the prior month, (other than the Equipment Rental Expense) will be included in the wire
transfer to Pinnacle on the 15<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> of each subsequent month pursuant to <U>Section
5.02(b)</U> above. The reimbursement of Equipment Rental Expense pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.06(a)
attributable to a month will occur as part of the provisional payment on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> of
such month pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02(b). Pinnacle will be responsible for providing Northwest with
a copy of all third party invoices and evidence of payment needed to determine the expense amount
and the timeliness of payment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Equipment Rental Expense &#151; less any performance guarantee payments or credits that
Pinnacle receives from the manufacturers.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Aviation Insurance &#151; Aircraft hull insurance and aviation liability insurance, including
war risk liability and hull war risk insurance, subject to the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle&#146;s aviation liability insurance (including war risk liability) expense shall
be the lesser of the expense based on the actual rates or &#091;***&#093; per Pinnacle Revenue
Passenger. Pinnacle&#146;s hull insurance (including hull war risk insurance) expense
shall be the lesser of the expense based on the actual rates or
&#091;***&#093; of Pinnacle
Fleet Value. The margin payment pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.08 or 5.11 shall be based on
the foregoing amounts. If Pinnacle&#146;s actual aviation insurance expense exceeds the
amounts above, the incremental insurance expense above the foregoing limits will be
reimbursed by Northwest. In the event that Pinnacle obtains aviation insurance
coverage as part of Northwest&#146;s aviation insurance placement, the rates used to
determine Pinnacle&#146;s share of the aviation insurance expenses shall be the same as
the rates used to determine Northwest&#146;s expense for such insurance.</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->35<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Engine maintenance &#151; The CRJ 200/440 engine maintenance performed pursuant to the GE
Agreements less any warranty payments or credits that Pinnacle receives, including but not limited
to those from GE, plus the cost of materials and components used in connection with unscheduled
off-wing maintenance performed by Pinnacle (not including maintenance or replacement of line
replaceable units or QEC items). Pinnacle shall provide to Northwest, upon reasonable request,
documentation detailing the unscheduled event and cost of each of the components. If Northwest and
Pinnacle agree at any time to have such engine work performed elsewhere, the reimbursement amount
will be adjusted to take into account the new arrangement. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
Northwest will not reimburse Pinnacle for engine maintenance performed pursuant to the GE
Agreements which is accomplished unreasonably in advance of the time such maintenance is required
in accordance with the Maintenance Program or which is accomplished for the sole purpose of
satisfying return conditions under the Lease.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Airframe maintenance &#151; The CRJ 200/440 airframe maintenance performed pursuant to
Bombardier Agreement less any warranty payments or credits that Pinnacle receives, including but
not limited to those from Bombardier. If Northwest and Pinnacle agree at any time to have the
maintenance work performed elsewhere, the reimbursement amount will be adjusted to take into
account the new arrangement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Northwest will not reimburse Pinnacle
for airframe maintenance performed pursuant to the Bombardier Agreement which is accomplished
unreasonably in advance of the time such maintenance is required in accordance with the Maintenance
Program or which is accomplished for the sole purpose of satisfying return conditions under the
Lease.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Deicing services and glycol &#151; subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.02 and reimbursed
accordingly:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) Deicing services and glycol at Pinnacle Service Cities, Contracted Service Cities
and Hub Cities where a contracted agent is performing the service.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) Glycol at Pinnacle Service Cities, Contracted Service Cities and Hub Cities where
Pinnacle performs the deicing function.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;Maintenance Facilities, subject to the provisions of <U>Section&nbsp;4.03 (c)</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;CRJ 200/440 auxiliary power unit (APU)&nbsp;maintenance expense, CRJ 200/440 avionics
maintenance expense and CRJ 200/440 landing gear overhaul expense less any warranty payments or
credits that Pinnacle receives with respect to any of the foregoing expenses.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;Hub City facility charges pursuant to Exhibit&nbsp;B.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Airport security-related equipment maintenance expenses and personnel expenses incurred
by Pinnacle pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.05 less any government reimbursement for such expenses.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;Landing fees incurred for Pinnacle operations in DTW.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;Property taxes, subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;8.03 less the amounts of any
refunds, subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;8.04.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, Northwest will not reimburse Pinnacle for any late payment
charges, penalties and/or fees which Pinnacle incurs in connection with payment of the expenses
listed above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.07 </B><U><B>Billing</B></U>. Northwest and Pinnacle shall bill each other on a monthly
basis in respect of amounts owed to each other under this Agreement not contemplated under
<U>Section&nbsp;5.02</U>. If such billed items are not paid by the party within sixty (60)&nbsp;days of the
statement date, the aggregate amount of undisputed items may be offset against or included in the
next scheduled wire transfer pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.02(b)</U>. Disputed amounts must be paid
when the dispute is resolved, provided that such amount may be set off against or included in the
next scheduled wire transfer pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.02(b)</U> if the formerly disputed amount is
not paid within seven (7)&nbsp;days of resolution. Northwest may also offset against the next scheduled
wire transfer pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.02(b)</U> the amount of any payment (including those under
any Lease) with respect to which Pinnacle shall have defaulted and shall have failed to cure before
the expiration of any applicable grace period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.08 </B><U><B>Monthly Margin Calculation and Payment</B></U>. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2007,
the monthly Margin Payment shall be calculated as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Monthly Margin Payment = (payments due to Pinnacle pursuant to <U>Sections&nbsp;5.03</U>,
<U>5.04</U> and <U>5.06</U>) * (.08 / .92)
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.09 </B><U><B>Annual Margin Adjustment Payment</B></U>. For the time period through
December&nbsp;31, 2007, the parties will calculate Pinnacle&#146;s Margin in accordance with <U>Section
5.09(a)</U> and, if required pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.09(b)</U> below, one party will make a
Margin Adjustment Payment to the other party.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Calculation of the Total Operating Cost and the Margin</U>. Not later than ninety
(90)&nbsp;days following the end of 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006 and 2007, Pinnacle shall deliver to Northwest
its audited financial statements including the calculation of its operating margin for Regional
Airline Services provided under this Agreement for the prior year (the &#147;Margin&#148;) by dividing (x)
Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Income for Regional Airline Services for such year by (y)&nbsp;Pinnacle&#146;s
Total Operating Revenue for Regional Airline Services for such year, subject to the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In calculating the Margin, the amount of any penalties (accounted for as a reduction to
revenue) pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.05,</U> <U>Section&nbsp;5.13</U> and/or <U>Section&nbsp;5.14</U> below
will not be included in Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Revenue, and the following expenses will not be
included in Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Cost:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) Increment above predicted employee bonuses and incentives as set forth in Exhibit
C hereto. Predicted bonus and incentive levels are the amounts used in calculating the
Block Hour, Cycle and Fixed Cost Rates for 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006 and 2007, respectively.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2) Increment above market pay rates for Pinnacle&#146;s employees per the Parity Pay
Agreement in Exhibit&nbsp;D.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->37<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3) The amount of any penalties pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.14</U> (if not accounted for
as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4) The amount of any depreciation expense associated with capital expenditures in
excess of $250,000 which are designated by Northwest as Section&nbsp;5.09(a)(4) items because
Northwest has determined that such capital expenditures are not necessary after taking into
consideration the Annual Operating Plan and Pinnacle&#146;s obligations under this Agreement,
within seventy-five (75)&nbsp;days after receiving written notice from Pinnacle of such capital
expenditure pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.01(a)(iv) below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5) The amount of any Fuel Burn Penalty Payment pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.05(d)
</U>(if not accounted for as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(6) The amount of any asset write-downs (excluding normal depreciation) or
extraordinary charges as defined by GAAP.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(7) The amount of any fines or penalties paid by Pinnacle to any governmental entity.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(8) The CRJ 200/440 Aircraft and Spare Engine return costs including termination costs
incurred by Pinnacle pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.02(b) above.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(9) The amount of any late payment charges, penalties and/or fees incurred by
Pinnacle.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(10) The amount of any payment from Pinnacle to Northwest pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.13 (if
not accounted for as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(11) The amount of any non-recurring items or adjustments relating to Northwest&#146;s
bankruptcy or the bankruptcy of Mesaba Airlines in the United States Bankruptcy Court for
the District of Minnesota.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Margin shall be expressed as a decimal rounded to the fourth place. The calculation of
the Margin shall be derived from Pinnacle&#146;s reported financial statements for such year and shall
be determined in accordance with GAAP.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Annual Margin Adjustment Payment</U>. With respect to each calendar year through and
including 2007, the Margin will be subject to the floors and ceilings in the following table:
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">With respect to each calendar year through and including 2007, if the Margin is less than the
applicable Floor, Pinnacle shall receive from Northwest an amount determined as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ppin = &#091;Total Operating Cost/(1 &#151; Floor)&#093; &#151; Rev
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Ppin
is the amount payable to Pinnacle, Rev is Total Operating Revenue for Regional Airline Services for the applicable
calendar year excluding the items listed in Section&nbsp;5.09 (a),</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Floor is the applicable floor from the above table, and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total Operating Cost excludes Items 1-11 in <U>Section&nbsp;5.09(a)</U> above.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">With respect to each calendar year through and including 2007, if the Margin is greater than the
applicable Ceiling, Northwest shall receive from Pinnacle an amount determined as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pnw = Rev &#151; &#091;Total Operating Cost/(1 &#151; Ceiling)&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pnw
is the amount payable to Northwest, Rev is Total Operating Revenue for Regional Airline Services for the applicable
calendar year excluding the items listed in Section&nbsp;5.09 (a),</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ceiling is the applicable ceiling from the above table, and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total Operating Cost excludes items 1-11 in <U>Section&nbsp;5.09(a)</U> above.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">An amount payable pursuant to this <U>Section&nbsp;5.09 (b)</U> is a &#147;Margin Adjustment Payment.&#148;
Northwest shall add in or setoff, as appropriate, any Margin Adjustment Payment in the next wire
transfer due to Pinnacle.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U>Audit of Total Operating Cost and the Margin</U>. Northwest shall have the right to
audit the calculation of the Total Operating Cost, the Margin and the Margin Adjustment Payment,
and shall report any disputes to Pinnacle. Any dispute not reported to Pinnacle in writing within
ninety (90)&nbsp;days of the receipt of the audited financial statements and Margin calculation by
Northwest shall be deemed waived. The payment in respect of any dispute shall be handled as a
disputed amount in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.07</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.10 </B><U><B>Rate Adjustments</B></U>. For the calendar year 2006, the Block Hour, Cycle,
and Fixed Cost Rates will be adjusted as described below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>One Time Adjustment Factor</U>. Effective for the twelve-month period beginning on
January&nbsp;1, 2006 (i)&nbsp;the Block Hour Rate used for the 2005 calendar year will be multiplied by a One
Time Adjustment Factor (OTAF)&nbsp;and multiplied by (1 &#043; CPPI), and (ii)&nbsp;the Cycle Rates shall be
calculated by multiplying the Base Cycle Rates for 2005, with the exception
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->39<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">of &#091;***&#093; of the NW Cities rate, by (1 &#043; CPPIB)* (OTAF). These adjusted rates will be used for
the twelve-month period beginning January&nbsp;1, 2006. The OTAF will be calculated as follows:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) Determine Pinnacle&#146;s actual operating expenses for the twelve-month period ending
December&nbsp;31, 2005, excluding &#091;***&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2) Determine the actual payment made to Pinnacle for the twelve month period ending
December&nbsp;31, 2005, &#091;***&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3) Divide the result of step (1)&nbsp;by the result of step (2).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Inflation Adjustment</U>. Effective for 2007, (i)&nbsp;the Block Hour Rate used for 2006
will be multiplied by (1&#043;CPPI), and (ii)&nbsp;the Cycle Rates, with the exception of &#091;***&#093; of the NW
Cities rate, shall be calculated by multiplying the Base Cycle Rates used for 2006 by (1 &#043; CPPI),
to establish the 2007 rates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U>Fixed Cost Payment Adjustment</U>. Effective for 2006 and 2007, the Fixed Cost
Payment formula will be multiplied by the OTAF.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;<U>Reserved</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;So long as this Agreement remains in effect, the payment rates and mechanisms set forth
in <U>Sections&nbsp;5.02</U> through <U>5.06</U> will be re-set every fifth year through good faith
negotiations, commencing with the rates effective for 2013, utilizing a payment methodology
consistent with the methodology utilized during the prior five (5)&nbsp;year period; provided, however,
that any increment above market pay rates for Pinnacle&#146;s employees, per the Parity Pay Agreement in
Exhibit&nbsp;D, will not be considered in re-setting such rates. The rates for the years between each
adjustment year will be determined by multiplying the prior year&#146;s rates by (1 &#043; CPPI).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;In the event the parties are unable to reach agreement on new payment rates and
mechanisms through good faith negotiations, the rates will be set utilizing the following
procedure: (i)&nbsp;the parties shall attempt to agree upon an impartial industry expert to act as sole
arbitrator, provided that if the parties are unable to agree upon an expert to so act, each party
shall appoint an expert, and the two experts so appointed shall appoint a third expert; (ii)&nbsp;each
party shall submit a set of proposed rates to the arbitrator(s); and (iii)&nbsp;the arbitrator(s) shall
choose a set of rates from those submitted without modifying either.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.11 </B><U><B>Reserved.</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.12 </B><U><B>Revised Annual Margin Adjustment Payment</B></U>. Effective for 2008 and
each calendar year thereafter, the parties will calculate Pinnacle&#146;s Margin in accordance with
<U>Section&nbsp;5.12(a)</U> and, if required pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.12(b)</U> below, one party will
make a Margin Adjustment Payment to the other party.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Calculation of the Total Operating Cost and the Margin</U>. Not later than ninety
(90)&nbsp;days following the end of 2008 and each subsequent calendar year during the term of this
Agreement, Pinnacle shall deliver to Northwest its audited financial statements including the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->40<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">calculation of its operating margin for Regional Airline Services provided under this
Agreement for the prior year (the &#147;Margin&#148;) by dividing (x)&nbsp;Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Income for
Regional Airline Services for such year by (y)&nbsp;Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Revenue for Regional
Airline Services for such year, subject to the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In calculating the Margin, the amount of any penalties (accounted for as a reduction to
revenue) pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.05</U>, <U>Section&nbsp;5.13</U> and/or <U>Section&nbsp;5.14</U> below
will not be included in Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Revenue, and the following expenses will not be
included in Pinnacle&#146;s Total Operating Cost:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) Increment above predicted employee bonuses and incentives as set forth in Exhibit
C hereto. Predicted bonus and incentive levels are the amounts used in calculating the
Block Hour, Cycle and Fixed cost rates for 2007, grown each year by multiplying by (1 &#043;
CPPI).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2) The amount of any penalties pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.14</U> (if not accounted for
as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3) The amount of any depreciation expense associated with capital expenditures in
excess of $250,000 which are designated by Northwest as Section&nbsp;5.13(a)(3) items because
Northwest has determined that such capital expenditures are not necessary after taking into
consideration the Annual Operating Plan and Pinnacle&#146;s obligations under this Agreement,
within seventy-five (75)&nbsp;days after receiving written notice from Pinnacle of such capital
expenditure pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.01(a)(iv) below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4) The amount of any Fuel Burn Penalty Payment pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.05(d)
</U>(if not accounted for as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5) The amount of any asset write-downs (excluding normal depreciation) or
extraordinary charges as defined by GAAP.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(6) The amount of any fines or penalties paid by Pinnacle to any governmental entity.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(7) The CRJ 200/440 Aircraft and Spare Engine return costs including termination costs
incurred by Pinnacle pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.02 (b)&nbsp;above.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(8) The amount of any late payment charges, penalties and/or fees incurred by
Pinnacle.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(9) The amount of any payment from Pinnacle to Northwest pursuant to <U>Section
5.13</U> (if not accounted for as a reduction to revenue).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(10) The amount of any non-recurring items or adjustments relating to Northwest&#146;s
bankruptcy or the bankruptcy of Mesaba Airlines in the United States Bankruptcy Court for
the District of Minnesota.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->41<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Margin shall be expressed as a decimal rounded to the fourth place. The calculation of
the Margin shall be derived from Pinnacle&#146;s reported financial statements for such year and shall
be determined in accordance with GAAP.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Annual Adjustment to Margin Payment</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to each calendar year effective 2008, if the Margin is greater than 8% but less
than or equal to 13%, Northwest shall receive from Pinnacle an amount determined as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pnw = (Rev &#151; &#091;Total Operating Cost/(0.92)&#093;) / 2
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pnw is the amount payable to Northwest,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Rev is Total Operating Revenue for Regional Airline Services for the
applicable calendar year excluding the items listed in
<U>Section</U> <U>5.12 (a)</U>, and</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total Operating Cost excludes items 1-10 in <U>Section&nbsp;5.12(a)</U>
above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to each calendar year effective 2008, if the Margin is greater than 13%,
Northwest shall receive from Pinnacle an amount determined as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pnw = (Rev &#151; &#091;Total Operating Cost/(0.895)&#093;)
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pnw is the amount payable to Northwest,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Rev is Total Operating Revenue for Regional Airline Services for the
applicable calendar year excluding the items listed in <U>Section
5.12 (a)</U>, and</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total Operating Cost excludes items 1-10 in <U>Section&nbsp;5.12(a)</U>
above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An amount payable pursuant to this <U>Section&nbsp;5.12(b)</U> is a &#147;Margin Adjustment Payment.&#148;
Northwest shall add in or setoff, as appropriate, any Margin Adjustment Payment in the next wire
transfer due to Pinnacle.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U>Audit of Total Operating Cost and the Margin</U>. Northwest shall have the right to
audit the calculation of the Total Operating Cost, the Margin and the Margin Adjustment Payment,
and shall report any disputes to Pinnacle. Any dispute not reported to Pinnacle in writing within
ninety (90)&nbsp;days of the receipt of the audited financial statements and Margin calculation by
Northwest shall be deemed waived. The payment in respect of any dispute shall be handled as a
disputed amount in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.07</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.13 </B><U><B>Non-Scheduled Flight Refund.</B></U>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->42<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to each calendar year during the term of this Agreement, Northwest shall within
thirty (30)&nbsp;days from the receipt of the final Block Hour and Cycle Report received pursuant to
Section&nbsp;5.02 for the immediately preceding year, calculate and notify Pinnacle of the ratio of
actual Block Hours for Non-Scheduled Flights to actual Block Hours for Scheduled Flights and the
ratio of actual Cycles for Non-Scheduled Flights to actual Cycles for Scheduled Flights. In the
event that either ratio exceeds &#091;***&#093;, Pinnacle shall remit to Northwest (through a set-off of the
next amount due from the <U>Section&nbsp;5.02</U> wire transfer) an amount equal to the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Refund Calculation</U>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Actual Block Hours and/or Cycles for Non-Scheduled Flights in excess of &#091;***&#093; of
the actual Block Hours and Cycles for Scheduled Flights, respectively, multiplied
by the Block Hour Rate and Cycle Rate, respectively, in effect for the immediately
preceding year pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.03 and as adjusted pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.10,
plus the amount of any Margin Payments previously paid by Northwest to Pinnacle in
connection with such excess Block Hours and/or Cycles; provided, however, that no
refund will be paid to Northwest with respect to Non-Scheduled Flights which are
Aircraft delivery flights. For purposes of this calculation, the cycle rate used
will be the average of the then applicable Cycle Rates weighted by the number of
Cycles in each category in Section&nbsp;5.03(b).</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Section&nbsp;5.14 </B><U><B>Performance Levels and Penalties</B></U><B>.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Pinnacle shall be subject to certain performance levels and penalties as described in
this <U>Section&nbsp;5.14(a)</U> (&#147;Performance Criteria&#148;) which shall be deducted from the Block Hour
Payment. If Pinnacle does not achieve the performance criterion, then a penalty shall be charged
against amounts owing to Pinnacle. Any penalty charge incurred by failing to meet Performance
Criteria shall be made in the wire transfer due on the 30th day of the second month following the
end of the Performance Period in question pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.02(b)</U>. The applicable
performance levels and penalties are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Completion Factor (calculated in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;2.10 (a)</U>):

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In conjunction with Pinnacle&#146;s on-time arrival performance, Pinnacle&#146;s target block time
performance &#091;***&#093; shall not exceed &#091;***&#093;. If Pinnacle&#146;s actual block time performance &#091;***&#093; exceeds
&#091;***&#093;, Pinnacle&#146;s actual arrival performance &#091;***&#093; will be adjusted downward by &#091;***&#093; per &#091;***&#093;
percentage point in excess of &#091;***&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Luggage Mishandled (calculated in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;2.10 (c)</U>):
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Customer complaints (calculated in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;2.10 (d)</U>):
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
