<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->C-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>EXHIBIT D</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>PARITY PAY AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Parity Pay Agreement</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The parties agree that labor costs resulting from pay rates in excess of Parity Pay Rates for the
pilot, flight attendant, customer service/reservations agent, ramp service, and mechanic workgroups
will be excluded from Total Operating Cost when calculating the Margin pursuant to <U>Section
5.10(a)</U> and <U>5.13(a)</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The parties agree that labor costs resulting from any significant work rule and/or Premium changes,
in lieu of above Parity Pay Rates will be excluded from Total Operating Cost when calculating the
Margin pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.10(a)</U> and <U>5.13(a)</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The parties agree that labor costs resulting from benefits which are in excess of industry parity
for the pilot, flight attendant, customer service/reservations agent, ramp service, and mechanic
workgroups will be excluded from Total Operating Cost when calculating the Margin pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;5.10(a)</U> and <U>5.13(a)</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The following definitions are used throughout this parity pay agreement:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Comparison Airlines</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall have the meaning throughout Exhibit&nbsp;D as the five largest
(by revenue) publicly traded U.S. domestic regional airlines operating primarily regional jet
aircraft.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Premiums</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall mean separate line, longevity, shift, license, skill or other
premiums.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>RAA</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall mean the Regional Airline Association, Washington, D.C.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Definitions provided in the sections below are applicable only to the section in which such terms
appear.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Pilot and Flight Attendant Employees</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>A. Procedures</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle&#146;s Pay Rates for the pilot and flight attendant workgroups plus hourly impact of any Bonus
Rate are compared to Parity Pay Rates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If Pay Rates exceed Parity Pay Rates in any classification, the labor cost for that classification
will be multiplied by the overage percentage and such product will be deducted from Total Operating
Cost for purposes of calculating the Margin.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Significant work rule and Premiums changes are evaluated on a case by case basis.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>B. Definitions</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Pay Rates</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall be the top of scale hourly rates of pay excluding Premiums.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->D-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>"</B><U><B>Bonus Rate</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall be the average bonus payment divided by the timeframe covered
(based on 2,080 hours per year).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>"</B><U><B>Parity Pay Rates</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall be the simple average of the Pay Rates at the Comparison
Airlines within a classification. In the event that a comparison airline reduces or eliminates its
Premiums and simultaneously increases its basic hourly rates, the portion of the basic hourly rate
equal to the Premiums shall be excluded in determining Parity Pay Rates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Customer Service/Reservations Agent, Ramp Service and Mechanic Employees</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>A. Procedures</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle&#146;s actual Pay for customer service/reservations agent, ramp service, and mechanic
workgroups is compared to projected Parity Pay.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If Pay exceeds Parity Pay in any classification, the difference will be deducted from Total
Operating Cost for purposes of calculating the Margin.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Significant work rule and Premiums changes are evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>B. Definitions</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Pay</B></U><B>&#148; </B>is the sum of all customer service/reservation, agent, ramp service and mechanic
employees pay, including any bonus payments, within a classification (i.e. customer service agents)
and shall exclude Premiums and any overtime premium.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Parity Pay</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall be the sum of all customer service/reservation, agent, ramp service
and mechanic employees Pay re-calculated using the Parity Pay Scale in place of actual Pay rates.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Parity Pay Scale</B></U><B>&#148; </B>shall be constructed by taking the average pay rates for Pay steps
for all levels new hire to year 10 (top step) of the Comparison Airlines as reported by the RAA.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Benefits &#151; All Employees</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>A. Procedures</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle&#146;s actual Benefits for all above employee groups are compared to the average Benefits of
the same or similar classifications of the Comparison Airlines as reported by the RAA.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>B. Definitions</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;</B><U><B>Benefits</B></U><B>&#148; </B>include but are not limited to pension, 401(k), health and dental
insurance, life and disability insurance, and other post retirement benefits. Benefits are
evaluated on an individual basis (i.e. Pinnacle&#146;s pilot pension is compared to the average pilot
pension at the Comparison Airlines as reported by the RAA).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->D-2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U><B>Data Requirements</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In order to assess compliance with the Parity Pay Agreement, Pinnacle agrees to provide Northwest
with data including but not limited to the following:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-family: Symbol">&#045;</FONT> Total labor costs by workgroup or classification (e.g. pilot)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-family: Symbol">&#045;</FONT> Pay scales to the extent they exist for all Pinnacle&#146;s workgroups.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-family: Symbol">&#045;</FONT> Pay scales for the Comparison Airlines as reported by the RAA for requested workgroups.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT style="font-family: Symbol">&#045;</FONT> Individual employees&#146; information including workgroup, longevity or hire date, bonus
payments received, hourly rate(s) of pay, hours paid at hourly rate(s) of pay, projected
hours paid at each pay step (1 &#151; 10) if not currently paid based on a defined pay scale,
for requested workgroups.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->D-3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>EXHIBIT E</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>PASS TRAVEL PRIVILEGES</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>I. </B><U><B>Overview</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It is understood and agreed that Northwest has purchased and therefore controls all seat inventory
on Northwest coded flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines subject to the Airline Services Agreement
entered into by Northwest and Pinnacle Airlines. Northwest, in its sole discretion, shall set all
prices and control all seat inventory on Pinnacle flights operated under the Northwest code.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Seats on Northwest coded flights operated by Pinnacle have an intrinsic value to Northwest and by
definition persons occupying perishable seats, either on a positive space or space available basis,
have revenue opportunity costs (displacement, dilution, etc.) to Northwest. Northwest will
therefore establish the policies for utilizing its valuable and perishable product inventory.
Northwest shall have the right, in its sole discretion, to establish pass travel policies for all
persons on all Northwest Flights, including those operated by Pinnacle Airlines.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">II. Definitions
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Northwest Flights&#148; shall mean all flights operated by Northwest or Pinnacle Airlines under the
Northwest designator code. If and to the extent Northwest enters into an agreement with any
regional carrier other than Pinnacle Airlines that provides for pass travel on the terms set forth
herein, the term &#147;Northwest Flights&#148; shall include the flights operated by such carrier under the
Northwest designator code.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Pinnacle Business Travel&#148; shall mean employee travel that is required to run Pinnacle Airlines&#146;
operations, perform employee job functions, meet with Pinnacle Airlines vendors, attend
company/industry meetings/training, or conduct company business.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">By definition, business travel to conduct company business would require a meeting with
another person (internal or external) and the vast majority of the trip&#146;s duration should be
related to the business objective. If a pleasure trip is taken in conjunction with a
business trip, the pleasure portion must be flown space available.
Examples:<br><br>
1. Extend business trip for personal reasons before/after.<br><br>
Example: Business trip from city A to city B. After meeting is complete, employee extends
trip by 2&nbsp;days in city B for personal reasons. Return flight from city B is leisure space
available at the employee&#146;s normal boarding priority.<br><br>
2. Round Robin. Business trip from city A to B. After business is complete, employee
travels from city B to city C for personal reasons, then returns to
city A.<br><br>
 &#151; Flights from B to C and C to A are leisure space available.</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Things
that would not quality as &#147;Business&#148; would be<br><br>
- - Emergency travel, funeral travel, etc.<br>
- - Familarization trips to visit cities where no business is conducted<br>
- - Employee recognition/rewards<br>
- - Any travel related to personal reasons<br>
- - Any travel by any person who is not an employee, such as a spouse or family member</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In enforcing Northwest&#146;s business travel policies, Pinnacle Airlines must exercise good
faith in determining what is valid company business and in doing so must comply with
Northwest&#146;s business travel definition and policies, as such definitions and policies may be
changed from time to time by Northwest in its sole discretion.</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Leisure Travel&#148; shall mean any travel that does not qualify as Pinnacle business travel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">III. Travel Privileges of Pinnacle Airlines Employees on Northwest Flights
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. <U>Travel Authority Cards</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest shall have the sole authority to issue travel authority cards for travel on
Northwest Flights (which by definition includes Northwest coded flights operated by Pinnacle
Airlines). Pinnacle Airlines will not be entitled to issue travel authority cards on
Northwest Flights; however, it may submit a request for the issuance of travel authority
cards for travel on Northwest to the Northwest Pass Bureau and Northwest, in its sole
discretion, shall determine whether or not to grant any such request.</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Requests for Travel Passes on Behalf of Any Person Other Than Employees/retirees/family
members of employees of Pinnacle Airlines</U>.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any request for pass travel on Northwest Flights for any person other than employees,
retirees or family members of employees of Pinnacle Airlines (for example, employees of
airlines other than Pinnacle Airlines) may be submitted to the Northwest Pass Bureau for
approval and Northwest, in its sole discretion, shall determine whether or not to grant any
such request.</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3. <U>Ticket Donations</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest agrees to provide Pinnacle Airlines with &#091;***&#093; positive space (inventory
controlled) tickets per year for charitable donations to be made at Pinnacle Airline&#146;s
discretion.</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4. <U>Collateral (i.e., free tickets, upgrades, Worldclub passes, elite memberships, etc.).</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest agrees to provide Pinnacle Airlines with &#091;***&#093; per year of collateral to be used
for Pinnacle Airline&#146;s business purposes (i.e., for sales, marketing, service recovery,
etc.). Northwest shall determine from time to time the types of collateral to be made
available to Pinnacle Airlines and the unit cost for each type of collateral product. The
list of collateral products and the unit costs thereof as of the date hereof are set forth
on <U>Attachment A</U> attached hereto. Ordering will be handled via Northwest&#146;s GMS
process.</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5. <U>Business Travel by Pinnacle Employees on Northwest Flights</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;<U>Officers and Board of Directors of Pinnacle Airlines</U>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest agrees to issue to the President and CEO of Pinnacle Airlines an F1 positive space
travel card that is valid for travel on Northwest Flights by the President and CEO and his
or her spouse and eligible dependent children so long as such officer is employed by
Pinnacle Airlines. This card will be valid for business or leisure travel.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pursuant to his prior employment agreement, Northwest will issue to Curt Sawyer, Vice
President &#038; Chief Financial Officer of Pinnacle Airlines a Y1 positive space travel card
that is valid for travel on Northwest Flights by Mr.&nbsp;Sawyer and his spouse and eligible
dependent children so long as Mr.&nbsp;Sawyer is employed by Pinnacle Airlines. This card will
be valid for business or leisure travel.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest will issue to other officers of Pinnacle Airlines (up to a maximum of 8
individuals) travel privileges on Northwest Flights consistent with the travel privileges to
which managing directors of Northwest are entitled from time to time. Currently such
privileges are as follows:</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Business Travel: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B1/F2 travel card.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Leisure Travel: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#091;***&#093; B1 trip events per year.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Members of the Board of Directors of Pinnacle Airlines who are not employees will be
entitled to receive a Y1 positive space travel card that is valid for travel by such Board
member and his or her spouse and eligible dependent children on Northwest Flights operated
by Pinnacle. The card will be valid for Pinnacle business purposes and for leisure travel
only. The card will not be valid for business travel on behalf of any person, company or
entity other than Pinnacle Airlines.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;<U>Other Management (Exempt) Employees of Pinnacle Airlines</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pinnacle Airlines may designate up to &#091;***&#093; management (exempt)&nbsp;employees who
will be eligible for B1 (coach positive space, capacity controlled) business travel on
Northwest Flights. Pinnacle Airlines shall submit the list of such employees to
Northwest annually and Northwest may, in its sole discretion, approve or disapprove any
employee whose name appears on such list for such travel privileges.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All other management (exempt)&nbsp;employees of Pinnacle Airlines who are not
entitled to the travel privileges described in B.1) above may travel on Northwest
Flights with boarding priority 2W, and, to the extent Pinnacle Airlines desires that
any such employee travel on a Northwest Flight for Pinnacle business purposes with
higher priority, Pinnacle Airlines may submit its request for positive space travel to
the Northwest Pass Bureau for approval. Northwest, in its sole discretion, shall
determine whether or not to grant any such request.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C.&nbsp;<U>Non-Management (Non-Exempt) and Contract Employees of Pinnacle Airlines</U>.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Non-management (non-exempt) and contract employees of Pinnacle Airlines must request
approval from the Northwest Pass Bureau for any travel on Northwest Flights for Pinnacle
Airlines business purposes. Northwest, in its sole discretion, shall determine whether or
not to grant any such request. Any such approved travel for Pinnacle Airlines business
purposes by such employees shall be on a space available basis.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;<U>Pinnacle Airlines Operational Travel Requirements</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Deadhead travel and travel for pilot or flight attendant FAA-mandated
training</U>. Pinnacle Airlines may book travel on Northwest Flights with boarding
priority of B1 for pilot and flight attendant deadhead and FAA-mandated travel. The
purpose of such travel must be supported by crew scheduling, crew bid reports, training
schedules or other records of Pinnacle Airlines&#146; operations. Such records must be
maintained for not less than one (1)&nbsp;year and made available for audit by Northwest
upon request.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#151;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any deadhead booking must contain the following restriction:
&#147;No origin/dest or date changes allowed, per Revenue Management.&#148;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any booking without the above stated restriction will be subject to a &#091;***&#093; fee.</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#151;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any Y1 booking must be pre-approved by Northwest. Any Y1 booking made
without Northwest&#146;s pre-approval will be subject to a &#091;***&#093; one-way fee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#151;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Y1 exceptions should be requested from Northwest Day-of-Departure (DoD)
desk.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Under no circumstance may positive space bookings be used to transport Pinnacle Airlines
flight crews to or from their home (i.e., commuting) or for other non-operational
purposes.</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Aircraft on Ground (AOG).</U></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the event Pinnacle Airlines&#146; operations require the transportation of Pinnacle
Airlines&#146; mechanics or other required personnel due to AOG, Pinnacle shall request
approval from the Northwest DoD desk for such travel at boarding priority B1, or if
necessary, Y1. Northwest, in its sole discretion, shall determine whether or not to
grant any such request.</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6. <U>Travel by Interview Candidates, Consultants or Vendors of Pinnacle Airlines</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines will be entitled to purchase travel on Northwest Flights for consultants,
vendors and interview candidates of Pinnacle Airlines to attend meetings at Pinnacle
Airlines locations for Pinnacle Airlines business purposes only on the terms and conditions
set forth in the Northwest Pricing Bulletin BN138, attached hereto as <U>Attachment 2</U>.
This Pricing Bulletin is subject to change by Northwest on an annual basis.</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">7. <U>Leisure Travel by Employees of Pinnacle Airlines</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It is understood that Northwest maintains complete control over the grant of all travel
privileges on all Northwest Flights, including non-revenue space available boarding
priority. Northwest shall be entitled to all fees and charges collected for pass travel and</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines shall not under any circumstances impose any fees, charges or surcharges
on any pass travel on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines other than those set
forth herein or specifically authorized by Northwest. Pinnacle Airlines shall be
responsible for the payment to Northwest of pass travel fees and charges relating to travel
by employees of Pinnacle Airlines or their family members, registered domestic partners or
companions, and all amounts collected by Pinnacle Airlines from its employees shall be
collected on behalf of Northwest and payable to Northwest on a monthly basis as provided in
Section&nbsp;III.9.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Travel by Pinnacle Airlines Employees on Northwest Flights Operated by Pinnacle
Airlines</U>:</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines shall administer pass travel policies on Northwest Flights operated by
Pinnacle in a manner that is wholly consistent with Northwest&#146;s policies as they currently
exist and may in the future be changed by Northwest in its sole discretion and shall
communicate clearly such policies to its employees. Pinnacle Airlines shall be responsible
for enforcing such pass policies with respect to travel by its employees on Northwest
Flights and shall notify Northwest in the event of any violations.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines agrees to conform its existing pass travel policies and programs to those
of Northwest as soon as reasonably practicable after the date of the Agreement. Such
conforming changes include but are not limited to the following:</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1) The boarding priority for Pinnacle employees on Northwest Flights will be as follows:

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

Airlines shall be no higher than those applicable to comparable employees of
Northwest</TD>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pass travel fees shall apply to all Northwest Flights (including
Pinnacle Airlines employees flying on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle
Airlines).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4) Companion/Buddy Travel Program.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pinnacle Airlines must terminate its existing companion/buddy pass
travel program.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pinnacle Airlines must terminate all pass travel by any persons who
are not employees of Pinnacle Airlines or family members of Pinnacle Airlines
employees (including without limitation employees of airlines other than Pinnacle
Airlines or Northwest) on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines unless
such travel is specifically permitted hereunder or an authorized officer of
Northwest approves such pass travel in writing. Northwest shall provide Pinnacle
Airlines with a list of officers of Northwest who are authorized to approve pass
travel not provided for herein.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines will be entitled to establish a new companion/buddy program for
Pinnacle Airlines employees for travel on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle
Airlines as follows:</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each employee of Pinnacle Airlines will receive 16 one-way trips each calendar
year on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle. Companion/Buddy travel passes may
not be used on Northwest Flights operated by Northwest.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The companion of the Pinnacle Airlines employee must travel with the employee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

travel on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines shall be consistent with
the fees payable by Northwest employees for companion travel on Northwest Flights
operated by Northwest.</TD>

    <TD>Boarding priority:</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">5)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Registered Domestic Partners. Registered domestic partners of Pinnacle Airlines
employees will be entitled to pass privileges on Northwest Flights in accordance with
Northwest&#146;s registered domestic partner program.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">8. <U>Booking/Ticketing:</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pinnacle Airlines agrees to use its best efforts to establish a link between its employee database
system and that of Northwest to facilitate the automated booking of travel by Pinnacle Airlines
employees. Until such link is established, Pinnacle Airlines and Northwest shall cooperate to
exchange such data and reports as are deemed necessary to facilitate pass travel in accordance with
the provisions hereof. Northwest and Pinnacle Airlines shall each bear their own costs and
expenses associated with establishing such links.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Once the linking of Pinnacle Airlines&#146; and Northwest&#146;s employee database systems are implemented,
Pinnacle Airlines employees will be permitted to book positive space and space available travel in
accordance with the provisions hereof using Northwest automated systems (RADAR, IVR) and via
Northwest Reservations, as needed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All travel must be by electronic tickets only, when eligible. Travel shall be by Northwest travel
cards or easy write forms for non-eligible e-ticket destinations. The use of trip passes, Pinnacle
Airlines ticket stock, or other such documents for travel on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle
shall be strictly prohibited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">9. <U>Payment of Fees</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest shall invoice Pinnacle Airlines on a monthly basis for all travel pass fees and charges
applicable to travel by employees of Pinnacle Airlines, family members, companions and registered
domestic partners of such employees, and for travel by Pinnacle Airlines vendors, interview
candidates, etc. hereunder on any Northwest Flight. Pinnacle Airlines shall pay to Northwest all
invoiced amounts within 30&nbsp;days after the date of the invoice. Pinnacle Airlines may elect not to
collect from its own employees the pass travel fees and charges applicable to travel by Northwest
employees so long as it pays such fees and charges to Northwest on behalf
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">of its employees pursuant to the foregoing. Any amounts collected by Pinnacle Airlines for pass
travel on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines shall be collected on behalf of and for
the benefit of Northwest and remitted in accordance with the foregoing. Pinnacle Airlines shall
have no right or interest in and to such amounts.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10. <U>Revocation/Termination/Modification/Amendment of Pass Privileges</U>. All pass travel
benefits described herein are deemed to be privileges and are subject to revocation by Northwest in
the event of a failure to comply with the provisions hereof and the terms and conditions of
Northwest&#146;s pass travel policies, as the same may be changed from time to time by Northwest in its
sole discretion. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Northwest agrees that any changes in Northwest&#146;s
pass travel policies during the term of the Airline Services Agreement between Northwest and
Pinnacle Airlines shall not (i)&nbsp;reduce the amount of tickets or collateral described in Sections&nbsp;3
and 4 hereof, respectively, (ii)&nbsp;reduce the relative boarding priority to which Pinnacle Airlines
employees are entitled to travel on Northwest Flights pursuant to Sections&nbsp;5 and 7 hereof, or (iii)
increase the fees and charges payable by Pinnacle Airlines employees for pass travel benefits on
Northwest Flights above those amounts payable by comparable employees of Northwest for the same
benefits.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">11. <U>Audit</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest shall be entitled to audit all records of Pinnacle Airlines to verify compliance with the
provisions hereof.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>IV. </B><U><B>Travel Privileges of Persons Other than Pinnacle Airlines Employees on Northwest Flights</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Northwest shall have the right, in is sole discretion, to establish pass travel policies for all
persons on all Northwest Flights, including those operated by Pinnacle Airlines. Pinnacle shall
administer travel and accommodate passengers on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle consistent
with all such policies established by Northwest.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It is understood and agreed that leisure travel benefits for Northwest employees will include
boarding priority equal to Pinnacle employees on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines,
based on seniority. Northwest employees traveling with companions/buddies will board with priority
5B. Northwest&#146;s employee travel fee structure will apply to all leisure travel by Northwest
employees on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines and Pinnacle Airlines shall under no
circumstances charge any additional fees, surcharges or other amounts to Northwest or Northwest
employees traveling on Northwest Flights operated by Pinnacle Airlines.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->E-8<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;F</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>CRJ Fuel Burn (Penalty) Formulas</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Note: </B>The formulas below are to be used for the calculation of fuel burn penalty as it pertains to
each performance measure and the All-in Rate. The penalty, while settled on an annual basis, is
based on a monthly calculation. The result of the calculation for each performance measure shall
be netted together to produce a net penalty, if one should exist. To the extent that formulas do
not yet exist (i.e. Cruise Speed and Altitude), the parties mutually agree to document those
formulas when those performance measures are implemented. Per Section&nbsp;5.05(d), the All-in Rate is
first adjusted for the variances that exist with respect to each performance measure, and then to
the extent an unfavorable variance to budget exists, the penalty formula below for the All-in Rate
is applied. A penalty is assessed if the cause of variance is deemed within the control of
Pinnacle. An example for a month is illustrated in Attachment 1 hereto.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>1. Excess Planned Fuel on Arrival (FOA)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Monthly Penalty:</U><BR>
(Average Actual FOA in lbs-Target) x CTC / &#091;***&#093; / Block Hours per Cycle x Total Block
Hours x Fuel cost per gallon
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Plus Margin applicable to the fuel expense reimbursement pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.08 or 5.11.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Assumptions:</U>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Block Hours based on scheduled and unscheduled operations/cycles that returned
legitimate FOA values (on the flight history database)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Cost to Carry (CTC)&nbsp;varies with average enroute time; CTC = (&#091;***&#093; x Avg ETE) &#043; &#091;***&#093;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fuel cost per gallon = actual price per gallon incurred by Northwest per Section
5.05(a)(ii) including into-plane fees and taxes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>2. Excess Planned Zero Fuel Weight (ZFW)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Monthly penalty:</U><BR>
(Average Planned ZFW &#151; Average Actual ZFW-target tolerance in lbs) x CTC x CTC / &#091;***&#093; /
Block Hours per Cycle x Total Block Hours x Fuel cost per gallon
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Plus Margin applicable to the fuel expense reimbursement pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.08 or 5.11.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><u>Assumptions:</u>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Block Hours based on scheduled and unscheduled operations</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Cost to Carry (CTC)&nbsp;varies with average enroute time; CTC =
(&#091;***&#093; x Avg ETE) &#043; &#091;***&#093;</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fuel cost per gallon = actual price per gallon incurred by
Northwest per Section&nbsp;5.05(a)(ii) including into-plane fees
and taxes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>3. Excess Auxiliary Power Unit (APU)&nbsp;Burn</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Monthly Penalty:</U><BR>
(Average Actual APU hrs per flight hour-Target) x Flt to Blk Hour Ratio x Total Block Hours x
&#091;***&#093; / &#091;***&#093; x Fuel cost per gallon
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Plus Margin applicable to the fuel expense reimbursement pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.08 or 5.11.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><u>Assumptions:</u>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>APU burn rate = &#091;***&#093; pph per Bombardier (w/Air and electric load)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>APU runs almost exclusively w/air load but not necessarily electric. Reduction in rate w/electric removed insignificant
per 9E</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Flight hours and Block hours based on all 9E operations (scheduled and unscheduled)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fuel cost per gallon = actual price per gallon incurred by Northwest per Section&nbsp;5.05(a)(ii) including into-plane fees
and taxes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>4. Cruise Speed </B>To be determined.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>5. Cruise Altitude </B>To be determined.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>6. All-in Rate </B>(to be applied after adjusting for known variances to performance measures above as
shown in the sample calculation set forth in Attachment 1 hereto)
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Monthly Penalty:</U><BR>
(Actual All-in Gallons per block hour-Target) x Total Block Hours x Fuel cost per gallon
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Plus Margin applicable to the fuel expense reimbursement pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.08 or 5.11.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Assumptions:</U>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fuel cost per gallon = actual price per gallon incurred by Northwest per Section
5.05(a)(ii) including into-plane fees and taxes.</TD>
</TR>



</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Execution Copy</B>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Jan</B></TD>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>All-in Gallons per Block Hour (adjusted)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="22%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
